title: Quick Thinking
description: Answer these rapid-fire trivia questions as fast as you can!

questions.question: How many letters are in the English alphabet?
questions.explanation: The English alphabet has 26 letters, from A to Z.

questions.question: What is the boiling point of water in Fahrenheit?
questions.explanation: Water boils at 212°F (100°C) at sea level. This is one of the most fundamental measurements in cooking and science.

questions.question: What is the capital of France?
questions.explanation: Paris is the capital and largest city of France, with a population of over 2 million in the city proper and over 12 million in the metropolitan area.

questions.question: How many sides does a triangle have?
questions.explanation: A triangle has 3 sides. The word 'triangle' comes from the Latin 'triangulum,' meaning 'three-cornered.'

questions.question: What color do you get when you mix red and blue?
questions.explanation: Mixing red and blue creates purple (or violet). These are primary colors, and purple is a secondary color.

questions.question: How many minutes are in one hour?
questions.explanation: There are 60 minutes in one hour. This system dates back to ancient Babylon, which used a base-60 (sexagesimal) number system.

questions.question: What is the largest continent by land area?
questions.explanation: Asia is the largest continent, covering about 17.2 million square miles — roughly 30% of Earth's total land area.

questions.question: Which planet is closest to the Sun?
questions.explanation: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun, orbiting at an average distance of about 36 million miles. Despite this, it is not the hottest planet — Venus is, due to its thick atmosphere.

questions.question: What is the freezing point of water in Celsius?
questions.explanation: Water freezes at 0°C (32°F) at standard atmospheric pressure. Anders Celsius designed his temperature scale with this as a reference point.

questions.question: How many teeth does a typical adult human have?
questions.explanation: A typical adult has 32 teeth, including 8 incisors, 4 canines, 8 premolars, and 12 molars (including 4 wisdom teeth).

questions.question: What is the smallest prime number?
questions.explanation: 2 is the smallest prime number and the only even prime number. A prime number is a number greater than 1 that has no positive divisors other than 1 and itself.

questions.question: In which country would you find the Great Barrier Reef?
questions.explanation: The Great Barrier Reef is off the coast of Queensland, Australia. It is the world's largest coral reef system, stretching over 1,400 miles.

questions.question: What year did the Berlin Wall fall?
questions.explanation: The Berlin Wall fell on November 9, 1989. This event symbolized the end of the Cold War and led to German reunification in 1990.

questions.question: How many bones does a newborn baby have (approximately)?
questions.explanation: A newborn baby has approximately 270 bones. Many of these fuse together during growth, resulting in the 206 bones found in an adult skeleton.

questions.question: What is the only mammal capable of true flight?
questions.explanation: Bats are the only mammals capable of true, sustained flight. Flying squirrels and sugar gliders can only glide, not truly fly.
